frame.name: Measure_by_action
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame involves words that provide a measure for some undelimited (mass) <fen>Entity</fen> by referring to an <fen>Event</fen> that a prototypical quantity (or duration) of the <fen>Entity</fen> stereotypically participates in. The <fen>Entity</fen> is not necessarily a physical entity, but may instead be an undelimited type of event (such as a noise, or an activity).
<ex>He put two <fex name="Event"><t>splashes</t></fex> <fex name="Entity">of cologne</fex> on his face.</ex> <ex>Sorry--there's only <fex name="Count">two</fex> <fex name="Event"><t>bites</t></fex> <fex name="Entity">of cake</fex> left.</ex> <ex>Add a <fex name="Event"><t>pinch</t></fex> <fex name="Entity">of salt</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition: <def-root>An abstract or concrete undelimited entity that is measured by the <fen>Event</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition: <def-root>The event that a delimitable quantity or duration of an <fen>Entity</fen> participates in.</def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. </def-root>
